NoExposureDetected.RegionCoveredBody: You have not been near anyone who reported a COVID diagnosis through this app.
NoExposureDetected.NoRegionSetBody: Provincial and territorial governments are working to support StopCOVID across Canada. In some places, people cannot yet report COVID-19 diagnoses through this app.
NoExposureDetected.RegionNotCoveredBody:
We’re not able to say whether you’ve been exposed.

People in your province or territory are not yet able to report a COVID diagnosis through this app.

It’s still good to keep placeholder_name on. That way, when people are able to report a diagnosis, we’ll know if you were near them.

Home.NoExposureDetectedDetailed1: You have not been near anyone who reported a COVID diagnosis through this app.
Home.NoExposureDetectedDetailed2: However, in some provinces and territories, people cannot yet report COVID-19 diagnoses through this app.
Home.ExposureDetectedDetailed1: You’ve been near someone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through the app.
Home.ExposureDetectedDetailed2: This does not mean you’ve been infected. But you should probably take some action.
Home.SignalDataShared: Thank you for helping to slow the spread

SignalDataSharedDetailed.One:
For the next {number} day, you’ll get a daily message asking for your  information.

Take care for yourself and your family during this time.
SignalDataSharedDetailed.Other:
For the next {number} days, you’ll get a daily message asking for your  information.

Take care for yourself and your family during this time.

Home.DailyShareDetailed: Sharing your information helps others to know if they've been exposed to COVID-19. Then they can isolate and slow the spread to others. No details about who you are will be shared.
Home.EnableBluetoothCTA: You need to turn on Bluetooth in your phone’s settings so StopCOVID can work.
Home.ExposureNotificationsDisabledDetailed: StopCOVID works by checking these messages.
Home.NoConnectivityDetailed: StopCOVID only works if there is internet access.

OverlayOpen.BluetoothCardBody: You need to turn on Bluetooth in your phone’s settings so StopCOVID can work.
OverlayOpen.EnterCodeCardBody: You were given an 8-digit number when you were diagnosed. This number tells StopCOVID to notify people you were near.
OverlayOpen.NotificationCardBody: You will not receive push notifications if you've been near anyone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis. Finding out potential exposures right away is essential to slowing the spread of COVID-19.
OverlayOpen.ExposureNotificationCardBody: Exposure notifications are needed for StopCOVID to work.

Tutorial.step-1: Your phone uses Bluetooth to collect and share random IDs with phones near you with StopCOVID installed. These IDs are stored securely on each phone.
Tutorial.step-2Title: If you have potentially been exposed to COVID-19
Tutorial.step-2: You will receive a notification if you have been near someone in the past 14 days who has tested positive for COVID-19.
Tutorial.step-3Title: If you test positive for COVID-19
Tutorial.step-3: Anonymously notify others who have been near you in the past 14 days that they have possibly been exposed.

Sharing.Title: Tell your friends about StopCOVID
Sharing.SubTitle: Every person using StopCOVID helps to slow the spread of COVID-19. Sharing this app will not share any of your personal information.
Sharing.Message: Join me in helping to slow the spread of COVID-19. Download the StopCOVID app: https://covidshield.app

YourData.Title: Your data and identity are private
YourData.Body2: any identifiable information about you or your contacts
YourData.Body3: your medical information, unless you choose to share it anonymously, if you test positive
YourData.Body4: Data collected through this app is never shared without your permission
YourData.Body5: Use of the app is voluntary. You can delete it at any time.

OnboardingStart.Title: How it works
OnboardingStart.Body1: Using Bluetooth, StopCOVID shares anonymous, randomly generated codes, with other app users nearby.
OnboardingStart.Body2: If you have been exposed to COVID-19 by another app user in the past 14 days, you will receive an anonymous notification.
OnboardingStart.Body3: If you test positive for COVID-19, you can anonymously notify others who have been near you, in the past 14 days.

ThankYou.Title: Thank you for helping
ThankYou.Body: Exposure notifications are on. You will receive a message if StopCOVID detects that you've been near someone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis.

DataUpload.FormIntro: Please enter your 8 digit StopCOVID code.
DataUpload.InfoSmall: Your random IDs will not be shared unless you give permission in the next step.
DataUpload.ConsentBody: You have been granted access by a health care professional to share the random IDs stored on your phone.
DataUpload.ConsentBody2: If you share your random IDs, others with StopCOVID who have been near you in the past 14 days will receive a notification that they have possibly been exposed. This notification will not include any information about you.
DataUpload.ConsentBody3: You will be notified once per day when new random IDs are available to be shared. You must grant permission each time for the random IDs to be shared. Sharing is voluntary.
DataUpload.ErrorBody: Your StopCOVID code could not be recognized. Please try again.

Notification.ExposedMessageBody:
You’ve been near someone who reported a COVID-19 diagnosis through the app.

This does not mean you’ve been infected. But you should probably take some action.
Notification.OffMessageBody: Turn on StopCOVID to get notified if you've been near someone who has reported a COVID-19 diagnosis.
Notification.DailyUploadNotificationTitle: Share your new informatin about people you were near
Notification.DailyUploadNotificationBody: Sharing your information helps people know if they've been exposed to COVID-19. Then they can isolate and slow the spread to others. No details about who you are will be shared.

BottomSheet.OnStatus: StopCOVID is on, Tap for more information
BottomSheet.OffStatus: StopCOVID is off, Tap for more information

RegionPicker.Title: Where do you live?
RegionPicker.Body:
Choose the province or territory whose public health guidance you need to follow.

This information is only stored on your phone and will never be shared with anyone else.
